title: ApneaScrap Lab
description: DIY Freediving Gear — Techniques, Versions, And Test Results

items.title: Research Notes: Blade Lengths for Freediving
items.content_html: I finally pulled together a quick comparison of what "long" and "short" blades actually mean for bifins. Across the usual depth fin brands there is a pretty clear split between competition-length blades and travel/pool blades.

items.title: Research Notes: Playing With Cantilever Beam Calculator for Fin Blades
items.content_html: I wanted to see how a simple cantilever beam model matches what happens with freediving fins. The idea is that a fin blade is essentially a thin rectangular beam clamped at the footpocket and loaded at the tip by the force of the water.

items.title: Research Notes: Blade Stiffness and Profiles
items.content_html: I finally pulled together a quick reference for how tip load ("hardness") and bending profile play together on long freediving blades. The clearest explanation I have found so far comes from this breakdown: ▶️ Blade stiffness explained.

items.title: Research Notes: DIY Carbon Monofin BOM
items.content_html: After mapping out bifins, I want to gather materials and design notes for building a monofin blade. This will be a bit more complex than bifins because monofins need more lateral stability and usually use internal reinforcements.

items.title: Research Notes: DIY Carbon Bifin BOM
items.content_html: Now that I’ve mapped out the foot pockets, I want to gather everything I need for actually building a short carbon bifin blade. This is basically my BOM (bill of materials) plus a few notes on layering and finishing.

items.title: Research Notes: Monofin Foot Pockets
items.content_html: This is the second half of my research — this time looking at monofin foot pockets. Most DIY monofins seem to either use dedicated monofin pockets or just adapt bifin pockets. I want to collect the options here to see which direction makes sense for a DIY build.

items.title: Research Notes: Foot Pockets for a Short Carbon Training Fin
items.content_html:
I want to build a short carbon bifin for pool and training.
Before cutting any carbon, I need to choose the foot pocket. These notes collect what I’ve learned so far.

The main questions:

  1. Which pockets are most commonly used, and why?
  2. Which ones fit DIY blades without heavy mods?
  3. How much do blade angle and rails matter for short fins?
  4. Where can I find solid references?

items.title: Welcome to the ApneaScrap Lab Blog
items.content_html:
We're starting a blog to share progress on DIY freediving gear and testing. Stay tuned for updates.

This space will host:

  • Research notes that capture experiments and the theory behind our DIY projects.
  • Updates on builds, repairs, and anything else happening in the lab.
  • Brainstorming sessions where we think through solutions to tricky problems.
  • Field tests as we take prototypes into the water and report what worked (and what didn't).
